summary: The current completeness proof uses BMCS-internal semantics (bmcs_truth_at, bmcs_valid) rather than the standard definitions (truth_at, valid, TaskFrame, TaskModel, WorldHistory). Seven structural divergences identified. The recommended approach is to build a new StandardCompleteness.lean bridge module that constructs a canonical TaskFrame (WorldState=CanonicalWorldState, trivial task_rel), canonical TaskModel (valuation from MCS membership), and canonical WorldHistories (from IndexedMCSFamily, universal domain) and proves a canonical truth lemma against the standard truth_at. The box case resolves via the CanonicalWorldState insight: since every WorldHistory assigns MCS values to times, phi-in-all-MCS implies phi-true-at-all-WorldHistories. Seven orphan files (~6,191 lines) are Tier-1 Boneyard candidates; one FALSE axiom must be removed.

artifacts.summary: Synthesized research report: 7 divergences from correct completeness form, CanonicalWorldState bridge architecture, Boneyard inventory, phased construction plan for StandardCompleteness.lean
Analysis of current BMCS completeness proof structure vs. correct completeness pattern for bimodal task semantics
Prior art analysis, Boneyard lessons (5 failed approaches), Mathlib patterns, recommended Henkin-to-Standard bridge architecture using CanonicalWorldState + soundness roundtrip for box case
Risk analysis: sorry/axiom inventory, Boneyard candidates, essential components, restructuring risks for Bundle/
